item.text: We're interested in new kinds of visualization and new ways to make them.
item.title: Related Visualization

item.text: As can be seen by [[Understanding Page History]] this can be complex, containing differing view points - and maybe realities.
item.title: Visualizing Page History

item.text: Both [[Federated Wiki]]'s and [[Liquid Democracy]] share the same need: to be able to visualise the network of connections.
item.title: Liquid Graph Theory

item.text: The [[Smallest Federated Wiki]] is designed around the idea of data, or [[Linked Data]] to eb precise. Every paragraph, that is every item in a wiki panel or [Wiki Story] is data (a [[JSON Object]]).
item.title: Wrap Data with Visualisation

item.text: GMap is an algorithm for visualizing graphs as maps. GMap (see also [[GvMap Algorithm]]), is a practical tool for visualizing relational data with geographic-like maps. It aims to capture the underlying structural information, clustering, and neighborhoods of complex data  - [http://www.graphviz.org/Documentation/GHK09.pdf pdf]
item.title: GMap Algorithm

item.text: GMap is an algorithm for visualizing graphs as maps. GMap (see also [[GvMap Algorithm]]), is a practical tool for visualizing relational data with geographic-like maps. It aims to capture the underlying structural information, clustering, and neighborhoods of complex data  - [http://www.graphviz.org/Documentation/GHK09.pdf pdf]
item.title: GMap Algorithm

item.text: I'd like to view a graphviz file in wiki. I can process it on the server but it seems difficult to get any rich format to display on the screen. Of course I want links so this makes image formats a non-starter.
item.title: Viewing Graphviz with Javascript
